column4: Google Earth is very slow and is not rendering. I know i it has to run i my PC because when i had WinXp it did work.
maybe it is a 3d issue, have you got an ati or nvidia card?
try glxgears first
is it working "acceptably"?
what fps are you getting in glxgears?
have you tried to disable compiz?
that means, system->preference->appearance and none
no, ubuntu by default ships with "nice 3d effects" enabled, but some 3d apps like google earth eat much more horsepower so disabling those ubuntu desktop effects can give the app the power it needs
that means, system->preference->appearance and none
that means, system->preference->appearance->visual effects and none
select the visual effect tab
can you see what "glxinfo | grep direct" returns in terminal?
it should say "direct rendering: Yes"
in fact your glxgears has very low fps, on my intel laptop i have 1062.682 FPS
well, first you have to make sure the via driver is loaded
after that, you can blame the driver
I have installed openchorme via Sinaptic
openchrome is the browser if i'm not mistaken
what link does it bear to google earth? :/
really I have no clue about it, but i'll google a little
thank you very much!
i think the drivers suck then :P
the "via" module should be the graphic driver
